books.title: Under Western Eyes
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: A university student in St. Petersburg is drawn into the activities of a revolutionary group against his will.

books.title: The Mucker
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A street tough undergoes a transformation as he navigates the dangerous worlds of Chicago’s slums, a South Pacific island, and the wilds of Mexico.

books.title: Our Nig
books.author: Harriet E. Wilson
books.summary: An autobiographical account of a young biracial girl abandoned by her parents and forced into servitude in the northern United States.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Green Meadow Stories
books.author: Thornton W. Burgess
books.summary: A compilation of four distinct but entwined animal tales featuring the denizens of the Green Meadows.

books.title: English as She Is Spoke
books.author: Pedro Carolino
books.summary: A phrasebook of unintentionally hilarious English.

books.title: Tartuffe
books.author: Molière
books.summary: A father announces his daughter will marry Tartuffe, a sanctimonious fraud and hypocrite.

books.title: A Princess of Mars
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: An adventurer finds himself battling alien civilizations on the strange surface of Mars.

books.title: The Borough Treasurer
books.author: J. S. Fletcher
books.summary: When a retired detective is found murdered, two business partners in a small Yorkshire town become the prime suspects.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Manly Wade Wellman
books.summary: A collection of horror and science fiction stories by Manly Wade Wellman.

books.title: Incidents in the Life of a Slave Girl
books.author: Linda Brent
books.summary: The autobiography of a woman who grew up in, and escaped from, slavery.

books.title: The Footsteps at the Lock
books.author: Ronald A. Knox
books.summary: When an unsavory pair of cousins goes missing from their canoe holiday on the Thames, detectives are called in to solve the mystery.

books.title: The Autobiography of Benjamin Franklin
books.author: Benjamin Franklin
books.summary: Benjamin Franklin writes about his youth, adventures, and achievements.

books.title: The Crowd
books.author: Gustave Le Bon
books.summary: Le Bon explores the psychology, motivations, and dangers of crowds of people.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A collection of William Shakespeare’s poems and sonnets.

books.title: The Devil’s Dictionary
books.author: Ambrose Bierce
books.summary: A witty, sharp collection of sardonic word definitions from the 1800s and early 1900s that provide a snapshot into the irreverent humor of early American culture.

books.title: The House on the Borderland
books.author: William Hope Hodgson
books.summary: An account of the terrifying metaphysical haunting of a recluse’s secluded home.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Manly Wade Wellman
books.summary: A collection of horror and science fiction stories by Manly Wade Wellman.

books.title: The Pilgrim’s Progress
books.author: John Bunyan
books.summary: An allegorical story of a pilgrim in search of redemption, followed later by his wife and children, passing through great trials before reaching the Celestial City.

books.title: The Innocents Abroad
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain travels abroad, offering witty observations on the places and cultures he encounters and commentary on the habits and foibles of his fellow travelers.
